description: Identifier of the work order linked to this asset entry.
Business asset number or code referencing the asset master; distinct from the surrogate key; confirm usage with SME.
Line sequence number for this asset within the associated work order.
Unique identifier of the asset referenced by this work order line, tied to the asset master.
Classification of the asset (e.g., vehicle, equipment) used for routing, reporting, and costing.
Human-readable description of the asset to aid identification.
Identifier of the specific subassembly or component worked on within the asset; likely references an asset subsystem; confirm with SME.
Code for the shop, department, or physical location responsible for the work or owning the asset.
General ledger or cost account to which this work’s costs are charged.
Standardized code describing the failure mode or reason the work was required.
Percentage of the work order’s total cost allocated to this asset line.
Free-text notes related to this asset entry on the work order.
Priority level assigned to the work for this asset, used to influence scheduling.
Assessment value related to asset condition, risk, or priority; meaning may vary by implementation; confirm with SME.
Date/time when work was completed or the work order was closed for this asset line.
Actual labor cost posted to this asset line.
Actual internal equipment usage cost posted to this asset line.
Actual parts and materials cost posted to this asset line.
Actual contracted services or vendor cost posted to this asset line.
Other miscellaneous actual costs posted to this asset line.
User ID that created this record.
Timestamp when this record was created.
User or process that last updated this record.
Timestamp of the most recent update to this record.
Actual labor hours spent on this asset for the work.
Sub-location within the site where the asset resides or where work occurred (e.g., building, bay).
Client-defined optional field for additional categorization or reference; meaning varies; confirm with SME.
Client-defined optional field for additional categorization or reference; meaning varies; confirm with SME.
Indicator that costs are in work-in-progress status for this asset line; likely a flag; confirm with SME.
Management unit or cost center responsible for the asset or the work.
Code identifying the maintenance activity or task performed.
Duration the asset was unavailable due to this work. Units likely hours; confirm with SME.
Date/time when work started on this asset.
Date/time when physical work finished for this asset (may precede administrative completion).
Free-text description of the problem, failure, or symptoms.
Meter value captured at completion (e.g., odometer or engine hours) for the asset; units depend on asset type.
Owning department, business unit, or external owner associated with the asset.
Detailed operational status of the asset (e.g., out-of-service, reserve).
Reference to a spatial geometry record used to map the asset’s location within a GIS.
Hierarchical path identifying the asset’s position within an asset structure or organizational hierarchy.
